page.title: 02GAMES IN BYFIELD
page.content: GAMES IN SCHOOL VARY WITH THE AGE OF THE CHILDREN.4-5 YEAR OLDS COPY WHAT OTHER PEOPLE DO LIKE PLAYING SHOPS OR BANKS.OLDER CHILDREN AGED 10-11 PLAY MORE SERIOUS GAMES.A GAME THAT IS PLAYED AT BYFIELD SCHOOL IS"KISS IN THE MUD".THE IDEA IS THAT SOMEONE IS "ON" AN HE HAS TO CATCH PEOPLE.WHEN YOU HAVE BEEN CAUGHT YOU NEED TO BE FREED AND THIS IS WHEN THE KISSING STARTS.TO BE FREED YOU HAVE TO BE KISSED AND SO THE GAME GOES ON.YOUNG CHILDREN PLAY GAMES IN THE EVENINGS JUST LIKE AT SCHOOL.OLDER CHILDREN PLAY IN GROUPS, NOT ALONE.WHEN PEOPLE COME TO YOUR HOUSE,GAMES CHANGE.THEY BECOME MORE SENSIBLE LIKE GOING FOR A BIKE RIDE. COMPUTER AND VIDEO GAMES ARE OWNED BY ABOUT HALF THE CHILDREN AND ARE POPULAR WITH THOSE ABOVE 8 YEARS OLD.BOARD GAMES ARE POPULAR WITH MOST CHILDREN.
